conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the motion of the charged particle in the magnetic fields B1 and B2. The particle moves in a circular path due to the Lorentz force in each magnetic field.
The radius r1 of the circular path in the magnetic field B1 is given by: r1 = mv/qB1.
The radius r2 of the circular path in the magnetic field B2 is given by: r2 = mv/qB2.
The period T1 of the circular motion in B1 is: T1 = 2πr1/v = 2πm/qB1.
The period T2 of the circular motion in B2 is: T2 = 2πr2/v = 4πm/qB1.
The time to complete a semicircle in B1 is half the period T1: t1 = πm/qB1.
The time to complete a semicircle in B2 is half the period T2: t2 = 2πm/qB1.
The total time t to return to point O is the sum of these times: t = t1 + t2 = 3πm/qB1.
